segments.text: I notice the water pouring over the edge of the sink, and it’s spreading everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, polishing a plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy stretching for the cookie jar, and I can’t believe how reckless he’s being.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and he’s going to fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just watching, waiting for her turn, completely oblivious to the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to slip on that wet floor, and it’s going to be a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm, but inside, it’s like a circus.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder why no one is doing anything about the water or the boy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how unaware everyone is in this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the cabinets, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think I need to step in before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR
